verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284>, and said<WH559>,
Should not the multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697> be answered<WH6030>? And should a man<WH376> full of talk<WH8193> be justified<WH6663>?
Should thy boastings<WH907> make<WH2790> men<WH4962> hold their peace<WH2790>? And when thou mockest<WH3932>, shall no man make thee ashamed<WH3637>?
For thou sayest<WH559>, My doctrine<WH3948> is pure<WH2134>, And I am clean<WH1249> in thine eyes<WH5869>.
But <WH199> oh that<WH5414> God<WH433> would speak<WH1696>, And open<WH6605> his lips against thee<WH8193>,

And that he would show<WH5046> thee the secrets<WH8587> of wisdom<WH2451>! For he is manifold<WH3718> in understanding<WH8454>. Know<WH3045> therefore that God<WH433> exacteth<WH5382> of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth<WH5771>.
Canst thou by searching<WH2714> find out<WH4672> God<WH433>? Canst thou find<WH4672> out the Almighty<WH7706> unto perfection<WH8503>?
It is high<WH1363> as heaven<WH8064>; what canst thou do<WH6466>? Deeper<WH6013> than Sheol<WH7585>; What canst thou know<WH3045>?
The measure<WH4055> thereof is longer<WH752> than the earth<WH776>, And broader<WH7342> than the sea<WH3220>.
If he pass through<WH2498>, and shut up<WH5462>, And call<WH6950> unto judgment<WH7725>, then who can hinder him?
For he knoweth<WH3045> false<WH7723> men<WH4962>: He seeth<WH7200> iniquity<WH205> also<WH995>, even though he consider it not.
But vain<WH5014> man<WH376> is void of understanding<WH3823>, Yea<WH120>, man is born<WH3205> as a wild ass<WH6501>'s colt<WH5895>.
If thou set<WH3559> thy heart<WH3820> aright<WH6566>, And stretch out thy hands toward him<WH3709>;
If iniquity<WH205> be in thy hand<WH3027>, put it far away<WH7368>, And let not unrighteousness<WH5766> dwell<WH7931> in thy tents<WH168>.
Surely then shalt thou lift up<WH5375> thy face<WH6440> without spot<WH3971>; Yea<WH3332>, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear<WH3372>:
For thou shalt forget<WH7911> thy misery<WH5999>; Thou shalt remember<WH2142> it as waters<WH4325> that are passed away<WH5674>,
And thy life<WH2465> shall be clearer<WH6965> than the noonday<WH6672>; Though there be darkness<WH5774>, it shall be as the morning<WH1242>.
And thou shalt be secure<WH982>, because there is<WH3426> hope<WH8615>; Yea<WH2658>, thou shalt search about thee<WH7901>, and shalt take thy rest in safety<WH983>.
Also thou shalt lie down<WH7257>, and none shall make thee afraid<WH2729>; Yea<WH7227>, many shall make suit<WH2470> unto thee<WH6440>.
But the eyes<WH5869> of the wicked<WH7563> shall fail<WH3615>, And they shall have no way to flee<WH6>; And their hope<WH8615> shall be the giving up<WH4646> of the ghost<WH5315>.
